moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 g6 3. c3: My opening seems a bit too passive. I'm a bit inexperienced in this line.
moves.3... Bg7 4. Nbd2 d6 5. e4 c5: Trying to open up the diagonal of black's dark squared bishop.
moves.6. Bd3 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nbd7 8. O-O: +- I like white's position better as he seems to have more opportunity, but the diagonal is a weakness that will need to be addressed in the future especially as pressure on d4 continues.
moves.10. e5: ?! Maybe I felt threatened or wanted to eat some of his clock. I don't think this move is necessary though.
moves.12... fxe6 13. Re1: Bxg6 is not possible since the pawn protects the d5 knight.
moves.15. Be3: Better than Qe2? I'll let you decide! Huzzah!
moves.15... Nxe3 16. Rxe3 Bxb2: ? I don't like this move. Although it maintains the extra pawn and clears black's doubled pawns, it creates a discovered threat for white and removes black's threat on the diagonal.
moves.17. Rb1 Bd4 18. Rxe6: I believe this is better than taking the bishop as that allows black's queen to get close white's king.
moves.18... Bxf2+ 19. Kh1 Qd8 20. Nxh7: ! regaining the pawn in an awesome manner
moves.20... Nb6: ? Kxh7 is of course instant death. 20. ... Kxh7 21. Qh5+ Kg8 22. Qxg6 Kh8 23. Qh7#. 20. Nf6 is better as Nb6 allows me to do this...
moves.21. Rxg6+ Kh8: ?? Kf7 seems to allow a glimmer of hope
moves.23. Rxg4: Qxg4 is a mistake as Qxd3 gives black a chance. After 23. ... Qe8 24. Qh3 black has no way to escape checkmate
